page.title: 11E.M.Forster In Stevenage.
page.content: {Rooks Nest House}on the outskirts of Stevenage became{"Howards End"}in the novel by{E.M.Forster},who lived there as a boy from 1883 to 1893.{Elizabeth {Posten}a composer,who lives there now, keeps it much as it was then,with the coal fireplaces and the old lantern. In the{kitchen}there is a row of bells on the wall,one for each room in the house,so when one rang,the{servant knew where to find Mrs.Forster. When E.M.Forster lived there,the house had no running water,gas or electricity, but he thought it was a lovely place to live.He had some memorable times walking in the fields,walking to{Ches- {field Park},riding his pony;playing in the chalkpits or at{Rooks Nest Farm. Many years later,his protests helped to save some of the countryside north of Stevenage ,now called{"Forster {Country",}from the New Town planners.
